```{r playbill}
library(readr)
playbill <- read_csv("C:/mat374/playbill.csv")
```
1. 
```{r, echo=FALSE}
prod_week <- lm(CurrentWeek ~ LastWeek, data = playbill)

# Show model summary
summary(prod_week)
```
The estimated regression equation is CurrentWeek = 6805 + LastWeek * 0.98

2.
```{r}

library(ggplot2)
w <- ggplot(data=playbill, aes(x=LastWeek, y= CurrentWeek)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method="lm", se=F, color = "darkblue")

w + ggtitle("Broadway ticket sales")
```
3.
```{r}
predict(prod_week,newdata = data.frame((LastWeek=c(500000))))
```
The predicted value is 497845.6 it's the result when we plug 500000 into regression equation on 1.The modelâ€™s residual standard error is 18,010, which is the typical size of the week-to-week deviations of actual revenue from the regression line.
